meanings.sent1: Her grandiloquence in the speech made it hard to understand.
meanings.sent2: The politician's grandiloquence was evident in his long-winded speeches.
meanings.sent3: Despite his grandiloquence, he failed to convey his message clearly.
meanings.sent4: The grandiloquence of the advertisement exaggerated the product's benefits.
meanings.sent5: The grandiloquence of the author's writing style left readers feeling overwhelmed.

meanings.definition: Speech or writing that is overly elaborate or exaggerated
meanings.sent1: The grandiloquence of the novel made it difficult to follow the plot.
meanings.sent2: Her grandiloquence in the essay impressed the teacher but confused her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The grandiloquence of his excuse for being late was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent4: The grandiloquence of the marketing campaign promised more than it delivered.
meanings.sent5: His grandiloquence in describing his achievements made others question his credibility.
